intro: Lastreopsis subsimilis, commonly known as the rock spikerush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. This perennial plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands. Its slender, grass-like stems are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers in dense clusters. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a hardy species in harsh environments.
